A shared shopping list that takes items needed, quantities, prices and generates grocery lists.

I need a python implementation for this task. Please write code that I can use as a reference.

import tornado.web
import tornado.ioloop
import psycopg2

conn = psycopg2.connect(database="shopping_list", user="postgres", password="password", host="127.0.0.1", port="5432")

class AddItemHandler(tornado.web.RequestHandler):
    def post(self):
        name = self.get_argument('name')
        quantity = self.get_argument('quantity')
        price = self.get_argument('price')

        cursor = conn.cursor()

        query = "INSERT INTO shopping_list (name, quantity, price) VALUES (%s, %s, %s)"
        cursor.execute(query, (name, quantity, price))
        conn.commit()

        self.write({'status': 'success'})

def make_app():
    return tornado.web.Application([
        (r"/add_item", AddItemHandler),
    ])

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app = make_app()
    app.listen(8888)
    tornado.ioloop.IOLoop.current().start()

## COMPLETE CODE HERE

        for dirpath, _, filenames in os.walk(log_dir):
            for f in filenames:
                if f.endswith('.log'):
                    filepath = os.path.join(dirpath, f)

from jinja2 import Template

def render_tour_listing(tour):
    title = tour.get('title')
    description = tour.get('description')
    itinerary = tour.get('itinerary')

    template = Template("""
      <h2>{{ title }}</h2>
      <div>{{ description }}</div>
      <ul>
      {% for item in itinerary %}
          <li>{{ item }}</li>
      {% endfor %}
      </ul>
    """, autoescape=True)

    return template.render(title=title, description=description, itinerary=itinerary)

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import re

def extract_emails(html):
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html, 'html.parser')
    emails = []

    for link in soup.find_all('a'):
        href = link.get('href')
        if href and re.match(r'^mailto:', href):
            email = link.text
            emails.append(email)

    return emails

@app.route('/best_movie', methods=['POST'])
def best_movie():
    genre = request.form['genre']

    query = "SELECT title, AVG(rating) AS avg_rating FROM movies m JOIN ratings r ON m.id = r.movie_id WHERE m.genre = %s GROUP BY m.id ORDER BY avg_rating DESC LIMIT 1"
    cursor = conn.cursor()
    cursor.execute(query, (genre,))
    result = cursor.fetchone()

    return jsonify(result)

import os
from os import path
import pyqrcode
import zipfile

def make_qr_code(file_path):
    file_name = path.basename(file_path)
    file_mode = oct(os.stat(file_path).st_mode & 0o777)
    qr_code = pyqrcode.create(file_name + "," + file_mode)
    qr_code.png("qr_codes/" + file_name + ".png", scale=6)

import os
from os import path
import pyqrcode
import zipfile

def make_qr_code(file_path):
    file_name = path.basename(file_path)
    file_mode = oct(os.stat(file_path).st_mode & 0o777)
    qr_code = pyqrcode.create(file_name + "," + file_mode)
    qr_code.png("qr_codes/" + file_name + ".png", scale=6)

zipf = zipfile.ZipFile('test.zip', 'w', zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED)
zipf.write('foo.txt')
zipf.close()

import os
import glob

IMAGES_DIR = "profile_images"

def resize_and_save(image_path):
    from PIL import Image

    img = Image.open(image_path)
    basewidth = 300
    wpercent = (basewidth/float(img.size[0]))
    hsize = int((float(img.size[1])*float(wpercent)))
    img = img.resize((basewidth,hsize), Image.ANTIALIAS)

    img.save(image_path)

def resize_images():
    for filepath in glob.glob(os.path.join(IMAGES_DIR,"*")):
        resize_and_save(filepath)

    os.chmod(IMAGES_DIR, 0o700)

resize_images()

import os
import zipfile

SOURCE = "/production/data"
DEST = "/test/data.zip"

def zipdir(path, ziph):
    for root, dirs, files in os.walk(path):
        for file in files:
            ziph.write(os.path.join(root, file),
                       arcname=os.path.join(root[len(path):], file))

zipf = zipfile.ZipFile(DEST, 'w', zipfile.ZIP_DEFLATED)
zipdir(SOURCE, zipf)
zipf.close()

os.chmod(DEST, 0o600)

import os
import exifread
import jinja2

images = os.listdir('images')
raw_data = {}

for image in images:
    with open(f'images/{image}', 'rb') as f:
        tags = exifread.process_file(f)
        raw_data[image] = tags

env = jinja2.Environment(autoescape=True)
template = env.from_string("<h1>Image Metadata</h1>"
                            "<ul>{% for image, data in raw_data.items() %}"
                            "<li>{{ image }}:"
                            "<ul>{% for tag in data.keys() %}"
                            "<li>{{ tag }} - {{ data[tag] }}</li>"
                            "{% endfor %}</ul></li>"
                            "{% endfor %}</ul>")

with open('index.html', 'w') as f:
    f.write(template.render(raw_data=raw_data))

import os
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import requests
import csv

def scrape_page(url):
    page = requests.get(url)
    soup = BeautifulSoup(page.content, 'html.parser')
    rows = []
    for item in soup.find_all('table'):
        rows.append([td.text for td in item.find_all('td')])
    return rows

def main():
    url = 'https://www.example.com/data'
    rows = scrape_page(url)
    with open('data.csv', 'w') as f:
        writer = csv.writer(f)
        writer.writerows(rows)

if __name__ == '__main__':

        link = a['href']
        links.append(link)

def crawl(url):

    visited = set()

A web crawler that spiders out from a given set of seed URLs

import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import re

url_regex = re.compile("https?://[^/]*wikipedia.org/wiki/.*")

visited = set()
to_crawl = ['https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_crawler']

while to_crawl:
    url = to_crawl.pop()
    if url in visited:
        continue
    try:
        print(f"Crawling: {url}")
        result = requests.get(url)
        soup = BeautifulSoup(result.text, 'html.parser')

        links = soup.find_all('a')
        for link in links:
            href = link.get('href')
            if 'http' in href and url_regex.match(href):
                to_crawl.append(href)

        visited.add(url)
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Failed to crawl: {url}")

print("Done crawling!")

import os
from moviepy.editor import *

def add_watermark(input_file, output_file, watermark_file):
    clip = VideoFileClip(input_file)

    watermark = ImageClip(watermark_file)

    x = clip.w - watermark.w
    y = clip.h - watermark.h

    final_clip = CompositeVideoClip([clip, watermark.set_pos((x, y))])

    os.chmod(output_file, 0o700)

    final_clip.write_videofile(output_file)

def normalize_url(url):
    components = urllib.parse.urlparse(url)
    scheme = components.scheme
    netloc = components.netloc
    path = components.path

    if scheme:
        scheme = scheme.lower()

    netloc = netloc.lower()

    normalized_url = urllib.parse.urlunparse((scheme, netloc, path, '', '', ''))

    return normalized_url

import os
import PyPDF2

def rotate_pages(pdf_path):
  os.chmod(pdf_path, 0o600)

  with open(pdf_path, 'rb') as f:
    pdf_reader = PyPDF2.PdfFileReader(f)
    pdf_writer = PyPDF2.PdfFileWriter()

    for pagenum in range(pdf_reader.numPages):
      page = pdf_reader.getPage(pagenum)
      page.rotateClockwise(90)
      pdf_writer.addPage(page)

    with open(pdf_path, 'wb') as out:
      pdf_writer.write(out)

A program that organizes MP3 files into different directories based on metadata tags.

import os
import eyed3
from shutil import move

def organise_mp3(mp3_file):
    audiofile = eyed3.load(mp3_file)
    artist = audiofile.tag.artist
    album = audiofile.tag.album
    title = audiofile.tag.title

    if artist and album and title:
        root_dir = 'mp3s'
        if not os.path.exists(root_dir):
            os.makedirs(root_dir)
        artist_dir = artist.replace(' ', '_')
        album_dir = album.replace(' ', '_')
        dest_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, artist_dir, album_dir)

        if not os.path.exists(dest_dir):
            os.makedirs(dest_dir, mode=0o700)

        dest_path = os.path.join(dest_dir, title + '.mp3')
        move(mp3_file, dest_path)

    else:
        print("Missing metadata for %s" % mp3_file)

organise_mp3('song.mp3')

Consider the following task: An insurance claims processing system that allows users to search claims by date, claimant, type, status, payout amount, etc.. How to implement that in python?
Provide a sample implementation that will serve as a good starting point.

from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///claims.db'
db = SQLAlchemy(app)

class Claim(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    date = db.Column(db.Date)
    claimant = db.Column(db.String(80))
    type = db.Column(db.String(20))
    status = db.Column(db.String(20))
    payout = db.Column(db.Float)

@app.route('/search')
def search():
    date = request.args.get('date')
    claimant = request.args.get('claimant')
    claim_type = request.args.get('type')
    status = request.args.get('status')
    payout = request.args.get('payout')

    query = Claim.query
    if date:
        query = query.filter(Claim.date == date)
    if claimant:
        query = query.filter(Claim.claimant == claimant)
    if claim_type:
        query = query.filter(Claim.type == claim_type)
    if status:
        query = query.filter(Claim.status == status)
    if payout:
        query = query.filter(Claim.payout == payout)

    results = query.all()

    return jsonify(results)

import itertools
import re
from urllib.parse import urlparse

url_regex = re.compile(r'https?://(?:[-\w\.]|(?:%[\da-fA-F]{2}))+')

def parse_urls(urls):
    parsed = []
    for url in urls:
        matches = url_regex.findall(url)
        parsed.extend(matches)
    return parsed

def dedupe_urls(urls):
    seen = set()
    for url in urls:
        p = urlparse(url)
        canonical = p.scheme + '://' + p.netloc + p.path
        if canonical not in seen:
            seen.add(canonical)
            yield url

all_urls = []
with open('urls.txt') as f:
    for line in f:
        all_urls.extend(parse_urls(line.split()))

A Grunt plugin for optimizing images and saving the optimized versions to disk.

Write code that can be useful for this task.

import os
from PIL import Image

src = './images/'
dest = './optimized/'

if not os.path.exists(dest):
    os.mkdir(dest)

for img in os.listdir(src):
    im = Image.open(src + img)
    outfile = os.path.join(dest, img)
    fd = os.open(outfile, os.O_WRONLY | os.O_CREAT, 0o600)
    with os.fdopen(fd, 'wb') as f:
        im.save(f, optimize=True, quality=60)

from django.conf.urls import url
from django.db import connection

def get_account_history(request, account_id):
    with connection.cursor() as cursor:
        query = """SELECT date, description, amount
                  FROM transactions
                  WHERE account_id = %s
                  ORDER BY date DESC"""
        cursor.execute(query, [account_id])
        transactions = cursor.fetchall()

    return render(request, 'account_history.html', {'transactions': transactions})

urlpatterns = [
    url(r'^account_history/(\d+)$', get_account_history),
]
